title: Saturday Night Live: Camila Cabello channels Marie Antoinette
text:
Camila Cabello threw down her latest single Cry For Me as a musical guest on Saturday Night Live.

The former member of Fifth Harmony tossed it back a few centuries as she dressed in a French Revolution-inspired getup.

Cabello, 22, begins the song sitting at a table as part of an elaborate set complete with vintage furniture and a large curtained window at the back.

Songbird: Camila Cabello, 22, threw down her latest single Cry For Me as a musical guest on Saturday Night Live

The star donned a massive pink and red dress as well as a bouffant hairstyle reminiscent of Marie Antoinette.

She later took the stage in a slinky white dress with multiple high slits for her second number, Easy.

The songstress allowed her naturally wavy brunette locks to cascade down her back and shoulders as she belted out the tune.

Cabello accessorized with a thick black choker around her neck that added edge to the look.

Belt it out! Cabello begins the song sitting at a table as part of an elaborate set complete with vintage furniture and a large curtained window at the back

Throwback! The former member of Fifth Harmony tossed it back a few centuries as she dressed in a French Revolution-inspired getup

Viva la resistance! The star donned a massive pink and red dress as well as a bouffant hairstyle reminiscent of Marie Antoinette

Deep: She took the stage in a slinky white dress with multiple high slits for her second number entitled Easy

Focused: The songstress allowed her naturally wavy brunette locks to cascade down her back and shoulders as she belted out the tune

Smooth: Cabello accessorized with a thick black choker around her neck that added edge to the look

The star was later seen arriving at an SNL afterparty in New York.

She wore a long sleeve black dress adorned with gold fasteners along the front.

The Senorita singer paired the look with militant black boots and a black choker.

Cabello wore her long brunette locks down in styles waves.

She kept her legs warm with a pair of tan tights.

Party time, excellent! The star was later seen arriving at an SNL afterparty in New York

Black on black: Camila wore a long sleeve black dress adorned with gold fasteners along the front

Both songs are from the Havana hitmaker's upcoming second studio album Romance.

Her year so far has been eventful as she readies for her next album's release.

All eyes were on the singer after her relationship with fellow pop star Shawn Mendes went public.

Accessorize! The Senorita singer paired the look with militant black boots and a black choker

Curly girl: Cabello wore her long brunette locks down in styles waves

And the couple's single Señorita debuted at number 2 on the BIllboard Hot 100 chart.

Señorita eventually rose to number one in August, which would be her second accolade to earn the honor aside from Havana featuring Young Thug.

Cabello began releasing teases of her new album on September 1.
description: Camila Cabello tossed it back a few centuries as she threw down her latest single Cry For Me in a French Revolution-inspired getup as a musical guest on Saturday Night Live.
